verses.verse: Sarah<WH8283> lived<WH2416> one<WH3967> hundred<WH6242> twenty-seven<WH7651> years.<WH8141> This was the length<WH8141> of Sarah<WH8283>'s life.<WH2416>

Sarah<WH8283> died<WH4191> in Kiriath<WH7153> Arba<WH2275> (the same is Hebron), in the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667> Abraham<WH85> came<WH935> to mourn<WH5594> for Sarah,<WH8283> and to weep for her.<WH1058>
Abraham<WH85> rose up<WH6965> from before<WH6440> his dead,<WH4191> and spoke<WH1696> to the children<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> saying,<WH559>

"I am a stranger<WH1616> and a foreigner<WH8453> living with you.<WH5414> Give me a possession<WH272> of a burying-place<WH6913> with you,<WH6912> that I may bury my dead<WH4191> out of my sight.<WH6440>"
The children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845> answered<WH6030> Abraham,<WH85> saying to him,<WH559>

"Hear us,<WH8085> my lord.<WH113> You are a prince<WH5387> of God<WH430> among us.<WH8432> Bury<WH6912> your dead<WH4191> in the best<WH4005> of our tombs.<WH6913> None<WH3808> of us will withhold<WH3607> from you his tomb.<WH6913> Bury<WH6912> your dead.<WH4191>"
Abraham<WH85> rose up,<WH6965> and bowed<WH7812> himself to the people<WH5971> of the land,<WH776> even to the children<WH1121> of Heth.<WH2845>

He talked<WH1696> with them,<WH559> saying, "If it be<WH3426> your mind<WH5315> that I should bury<WH6912> my dead<WH4191> out of my sight,<WH6440> hear<WH8085> me,<WH6293> and entreat for me to Ephron<WH6085> the son<WH1121> of Zohar,<WH6714>

that he may give<WH5414> me the cave<WH4631> of Machpelah,<WH4375> which he has,<WH7097> which is in the end of his field.<WH7704> For the full<WH4392> price<WH3701> let him give it<WH5414> to me among you<WH8432> for a possession<WH272> of a burying-place.<WH6913>"

Now Ephron<WH6085> was sitting<WH3427> in the middle<WH8432> of the children<WH1121> of Heth.<WH2845> Ephron<WH6085> the Hittite<WH2850> answered<WH6030> Abraham<WH85> in the hearing<WH241> of the children<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> even of all who went in<WH935> at the gate<WH8179> of his city,<WH5892> saying,<WH559>

"No,<WH113> my lord, hear me.<WH8085> I<WH5414> give you the field,<WH7704> and I<WH5414> give you the cave<WH4631> that is in it.<WH5414> In the presence<WH5869> of the children<WH1121> of my people<WH5971> I give<WH5414> it to you.<WH6912> Bury your dead.<WH4191>"
Abraham<WH85> bowed himself down<WH7812> before<WH6440> the people<WH5971> of the land.<WH776>

He spoke<WH1696> to Ephron<WH6085> in the audience<WH241> of the people<WH5971> of the land,<WH776> saying,<WH559> "But if you<WH3863> will,<WH8085> please hear me.<WH5414> I will give the price<WH3701> of the field.<WH7704> Take<WH3947> it from me,<WH6912> and I will bury my dead there.<WH4191>"
Ephron<WH6085> answered<WH6030> Abraham,<WH85> saying to him,<WH559>

"My lord,<WH113> listen<WH8085> to me.<WH776> What is a piece of land worth four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701> between<WH996> me and you?<WH6912> Therefore bury your dead.<WH4191>"

Abraham<WH85> listened<WH8085> to Ephron.<WH6085> Abraham<WH85> weighed<WH8254> to Ephron<WH6085> the silver<WH3701> which he had named<WH1696> in the audience<WH241> of the children<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of silver,<WH3701> according to the current<WH5674> merchants<WH5503>' standard.

So the field<WH7704> of Ephron,<WH6085> which was in Machpelah,<WH4375> which was before<WH6440> Mamre,<WH4471> the field,<WH7704> the cave<WH4631> which was in it,<WH6086> and all the trees that were in the field,<WH7704> that were in all of its<WH5439> borders,<WH1366> were deeded<WH6965>
to Abraham<WH85> for a possession<WH4736> in the presence<WH5869> of the children<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> before all who went in<WH935> at the gate<WH8179> of his city.<WH5892>

After<WH310> this,<WH3651> Abraham<WH85> buried<WH6912> Sarah<WH8283> his wife<WH802> in the cave<WH4631> of the field<WH7704> of Machpelah<WH4375> before<WH6440> Mamre<WH4471> (that is,<WH2275> Hebron), in the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667>
The field,<WH7704> and the cave<WH4631> that is in it,<WH6965> were deeded to Abraham<WH85> for a possession<WH272> of a burying place<WH6913> by the children<WH1121> of Heth.<WH2845>
